TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataObjectMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class DataObjectMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class DataObjectMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies a data operation method exposed by a type, what type of operation the method performs, and whether the method is the default data method. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> to identify data operation methods on a type marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute so that they are more easily identified by callers using reflection. When the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute is applied to a method, it describes the type of operation the method performs and indicates whether the method is the default data operation method of a type. Components such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> class examine the values of this attribute, if present, to help determine which data method to call at run time.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute to a publicly exposed method and identify the type of data operation it performs as well as whether it is the type's default data method. In this example the `NorthwindData` type exposes two data methods: one to retrieve a set of data named `GetAllEmployees`, and another to delete data named `DeleteEmployeeByID`. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute is applied to both methods, the `GetAllEmployees` method is marked as the default method for the Select data operation, and the `DeleteEmployeeByID` method is marked as the default method for the Delete data operation.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/CS/dataobjectmethodattribute.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/VB/dataobjectmethodattribute.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and identifies the type of data operation the method performs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.IsDefault%2A> property is set to `false` when you create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> object using this <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.%23ctor%28System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodType%29> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute to a publicly exposed method and identify the type of data operation it performs as well as whether it is the type's default data method. In this example the `NorthwindData` type exposes two data methods: one to retrieve a set of data named `GetAllEmployees`, and another to delete data named `DeleteEmployeeByID`. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute is applied to both methods, the `GetAllEmployees` method is marked as the default method for the Select data operation, and the `DeleteEmployeeByID` method is marked as the default method for the Delete data operation.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/CS/dataobjectmethodattribute.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/VB/dataobjectmethodattribute.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute to a publicly exposed method and identify the type of data operation it performs as well as whether it is the type's default data method. In this example the `NorthwindData` type exposes two data methods: one to retrieve a set of data named `GetAllEmployees`, and another to delete data named `DeleteEmployeeByID`. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> attribute is applied to both methods, the `GetAllEmployees` method is marked as the default method for the Select data operation, and the `DeleteEmployeeByID` method is marked as the default method for the Delete data operation.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method that the is applied to is the default data method exposed by the data object for a specific method type.
Docs.value: if the method is the default method exposed by the object for a method type; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control uses the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.IsDefault%2A> property to distinguish between multiple methods that match the signature requirements for a specific method type. If two methods match the signature requirements, the method with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.IsDefault%2A> property set to `true` is selected.
At design-time the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.IsDefault%2A> property is used to automatically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.SelectMethod%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.UpdateMethod%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.DeleteMethod%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.InsertMethod%2A> properties on an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> instance.
If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> is created using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.%23ctor%28System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodType%29> constructor that only takes a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodType> parameter, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.IsDefault%2A> property is set to `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method determines whether one <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute> fits the pattern of another. Its implementation is not the same as that of <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute.Equals%2A>, however, because it does not test for true equality.
